column4: DasEI; I usually install linux on a separate partition but this fellow I doing this for does not want me to partition his hard drive - have never done an install of Hardy without doing a partition.
DasTO; Yes - not really - but only way if can not partition.
DasEI; Does the wubi work fairly well?

You can ACTUALL install Ubuntu without doing a partition using VM (Virtual boxes).  But thats a whole altogether different animal.  If you are planning to use a VM, it will let you create a self-growing Virtual Hard-disk file.. That becomes your primary partition/volume.
